item.title: About
item.description: This blog is owned and operated by Masumbuko Semba. He is a data scientist works at the Nelson Mandela African Institution of Science and Technology but now doing a doctoral degree in physical oceanogrphy at the University of Dar es Salaam. He specializes in Earth Observations, where he use open-source geo-spatial tools and satellite observations to understand the physical processes that cause changes in our environments. Among the project he is involved is Global Drifter Program, where he works with the Physical Oceanographic Division of the Atlantic Oceanographic and Meteorological Laboratory (AOML) of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to understnd the ocean circulation in the Tropical Indian Ocean region.

item.title: Getting and Processing Satellite Data made easier in R
item.description: Introduction: A Brief Overview The amount of data being generated by satellites has soared in recent years. The proliferation of remote sensing data can be explained by recent advancements in satellite technologies. However, according to Febvre1, this advancement set another challenge of handling and processing pentabyte of data satellite generates. Thanks to ERDDAP, for being in front-line to overcome this challenge. We can obtain satellite data within the geographical extent of the area we are interested.
